Name: Natchez
Comment: no pronouns are used for S/A/P

Name: Kariri
Comment: Information in the grammar does not allow to understand the indexation. Although the absolutive argument seems to be indexed, the conditions under which this indexation occurs is unclear. It seems that 1st & 2nd person are more regularly indexed than 3rd person, and it seems that indexation mostly occurs in non-past (i.e. non exemplar) events.

Name: Coahuilteco
Comment: description insufficient to produce a report for indexing.

Name: Hattic
Comment: The language lacks free pronouns

Name: Andoque
Comment: Andoque has a very small group of attributive verbs that behave differently than all other verbs. However most attributive verbs behave normally and the divide is not semantically motivated. We have not considered this a case of split alignment along a stative/active divide.

Name: Kanoê
Comment: the two grammars (bacelar2004kanoe:220; bacelar2023kanoe:667-668) have slightly different accounts, but the main issue is that some examples contradict the prose. Alignment SEEMS (1) neutral for the exemplar, more specifically unmarked alignment for past perfective events; (2) accusative (S and A indexation), and, (3) for a subcategory of verb, namely the mental process verbs like 'like', 'think', etc) it seems to be accusative with object indexation too.

Name: Limilngan
Comment: no coding possible for indexing, gaps in the local scenarios of the co-argument sensitive paradigm

Name: Caddo
Comment: no pronouns are used fo S/A/P

Name: Southern Haida
Comment: no pronouns used for 3sgPro-low S/A

Name: Cherokee
Comment: no pronouns are used for 3rd person S/A/P

Name: Southern-Coastal Tsimshian
Comment: No pronouns in A role can be realized; in dependent clauses, Series I (rather than Series III) is used for indexing A.

Name: Western Keres
Comment: no pronouns for S/A/P roles

Name: Urningangg
Comment: description insufficient to produce a report for indexing.

Name: Wichita
Comment: Wichita has no free pronouns (rood1976wichita: 10)

Name: Catawba
Comment: Report completed, but not sufficient to code for indexing. There are gaps in the paradigm and there is no way to fill them. Also, there is no certainty as to the distribution of zeros.

Name: Chukchi
Comment: Chukchi has many paradigms which vary a little bit one to the other, and may affect alignment slightly. Rather than coding all of the complex paradigms, we picked a representative one based on the exemplar case and coded for it (NFUT/NEU).

Name: Madi
Comment: no pronoun is used for 3sg S/A/P

Name: Huron-Wyandot
Comment: no pronouns are used for S/A/P; for indexing Onondaga is coded instead

Name: Krongo
Comment: No pronouns are used for the 3rd person S/A

Name: Mundurukú
Comment: pronouns are not used in the P role

Name: Tuscarora
Comment: no pronouns for S/A/P roles

Name: Chimila
Comment: The indexation was a mess -- appears to be a Tupi-style inverse system with one slot, but the language is underdescribed and the grammar was not clear. The chart was put together without any examples of 1>2 or 2>1 scenarios, drawing inferences that they index subject.

Name: Miami
Comment: description insufficient to produce a report for indexing

Name: Matsés
Comment: no pronouns are used for 3rd person in any of the S/A/P roles

Name: Ottawa
Comment: description insufficient to produce a report for indexing

Name: Navajo
Comment: no pronouns are used for P

Name: Malecite-Passamaquoddy
Comment: This language does not allow inanimate>inanimate scenarios. Our machinery has no way of noting that a particular scenario is impossible, so this context has simply not been encoded.
